description: Dr. (Col) C.P. Roy has over 37 years of exceptionally rich experience in cardiac sciences, where he has held past affiliations and duties as Head of the Office of Medical Instruction (Cardiology) and Senior Expert in Cardiology. Among other recognized features, Dr. Roy has, also, during his professional journey, trained numerous postgraduate students in the DNB (cardiology) and PGDCC (Postgraduate Diploma in Clinical Cardiology).

Dr. Roy completed his MBBS and MD in medicine from the Armed Forces Medical College, Pune, and later did his DM in Cardiology from the prestigious Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research, Chandigarh.

He has served for more than 30 years and has had extensive experiences in various Armed Forces hospitals. He was a professor of Cardiology at AFMC, Pune, actively contributing to the training of DM Cardiology students. His experience as a postgraduate educator and examiner for both DM and DNB Cardiology is immense. His expertise has been recognized with the prestigious Vishisht Seva Award (VSM), awarded by the Honorable President of India for his exceptional contributions in cardiology.

Before joining Max Healthcare, Dr. Roy spent eight years at Escorts Heart Institute & Research Centre, New Delhi, as a senior specialist. Here, he worked on mentoring DNB students in cardiology, and his scholarly contributions are documented in various publications and research outcomes.
